text: Sometimes, a new package comes along to fill a need that you didn't realize you had. This is cool: <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/ann-packagecompatui/58118>

attachments.title: [ANN] PackageCompatUI
attachments.text: PackageCompatUI is a terminal text interface to the [compat] section of a Julia Project.toml file. This is particularly useful when setting up [compat] for a new package or if you need unusual [compat] bounds but is uncertain about the syntax to use. To keep up to date with breaking versions of dependencies, CompatHelper is the canonical tool. Installation Julia 1.6 is required. Use the REPL Pkg mode as usual for a registered package or using Pkg Pkg.add("PackageCompatUI") Add it to your de...

elements.text: Sometimes, a new package comes along to fill a need that you didn't realize you had. This is cool:

text: I did realize I had a need and stumbled on `REPL.TerminalMenus` but it took a couple of PRs to get the functionality I needed from `TerminalMenus` and then needed to wait for 1.6 before I could properly release it.

text: `REPL.TerminalMenus` is an underrated but amazingly handy and powerful module built into base. I am happy to see more and more projects using it!
